document.docAuthor: Delvare, G., Escolà, A. Ribes, Stojanova, A. M., Benoit, L., Lecomte, J. & Askew, R. R.
document.masterDocTitle: Exploring insect biodiversity: the parasitic Hymenoptera, chiefly Chalcidoidea, associated with seeds of asphodels (Xanthorrhoeaceae), with the description of nine new species belonging to Eurytomidae and Torymidae

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Exploring insect biodiversity: the parasitic Hymenoptera, chiefly Chalcidoidea, associated with seeds of asphodels (Xanthorrhoeaceae), with the description of nine new species belonging to Eurytomidae and Torymidae

12.vi.2010
( H. Dumas ) ( 2 ♂ , 1 in RAPC , 1 lost)
;

seeds

,
24.vi.2011

;

235 m

14.vi.2011
ovipositing in fruit of same asphodel, same collector ( 1 ♀ , in RAPC )
;
19.vi.2011
ex seeds same asphodel and collector ( 2 ♀ , in RAPC )
;

;

: Muğla , Datça , Mesüdiye ,
150 m
, 36.6967°N 27.55822°E , ex
seeds of
Asphodelus
sp.
19.ix.2010
( A. Stojanova ) ( 5 ♀ 5 ♂ , in RAPC ; 78 ♀ 42 ♂ , in ASPC )
;
TADJIKISTAN
, Gissaf Mountain Range ,
25.iii.1981
( M. Zerova ) ( 1 ♀ 1 ♂ ) [identified by M. Zerova as
Eurytoma collina Zerova
]

Aximopsis collina
was originally described in
Eurytoma ( Zerova 1984 )
. It has been recorded as a parasitoid in galls of
Diplolepis
( Cynipidae ) on
Rosa
:
D. mayri (Schlechtendal)
in Central Asia ( Zerova 2010 ) and Spain (new record),
D. fructuum (Rübsaamen)
in Iran (
Lotfalizadeh et al. 2006
), and
D. rosae (Linnaeus)
in France and Iran (
Askew et al. 2006
). Specimens reared in this study from asphodel fruits have been compared with non-type material of
A. collina
, kindly lent to us by Marina Zerova, and found to be conspecific.

Diagnosis . As for
A. balajasi
except that gaster is only 1.55–1.7× as long as high.

Biology .
Aximopsis collina
has been found associated with
A. albus albus ,
an apparently ovipositing female being observed on an exposed seed in a fruit on
14.vi. 2011
in Dordogne, France , and it has been reared from fruits of an unidentified species of
Asphodelus
in Turkey , but its host relations on
Asphodelus
remain obscure. In both Mallorca, and on the Causse de Larzac ( France ),
A. collina
was reared in some numbers from, respectively,
A. ramosus
and
A. cerasiferus
, but no
Eurytoma asphodeli
were obtained from these samples. All emergences ( 9 ♀ 3 ♂ ) have been in the first year of the fruits.
